definition.name: NXgrating
definition.doc: A diffraction grating, as could be used in a soft X-ray monochromator

field.name: angles
field.doc: Blaze or trapezoidal angles, with the angle of the upstream facing edge listed first. Blazed gratings can be identified by the low value of the first-listed angle.

field.name: period
field.doc: List of polynomial coefficients describing the spatial separation of lines/grooves as a function of position along the grating, in increasing powers of position. Gratings which do not have variable line spacing will only have a single coefficient (constant).

field.name: deflection_angle
field.doc: Angle between the incident beam and the utilised outgoing beam.

field.name: layer_thickness
field.doc: An array describing the thickness of each layer

group.name: shape
group.doc: A NXshape group describing the shape of the mirror

group.name: figure_data
group.doc: Numerical description of the surface figure of the mirror.

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which child group contains a path leading to a :ref:`NXdata` group.
It is recommended (as of NIAC2014) to use this attribute to help define the path to the default dataset to be plotted. See https://www.nexusformat.org/2014_How_to_find_default_data.html for a summary of the discussion.
